Articles.Content:
I'd like to suggest that the mobility ladders need to have a default 'step on top' if there are no more rungs available. At the moment, if you have a ladder attached to the side of your vehicle, you can't use the ladder to get onto the top surface (eg top of structure, ledge or other contrivance).

as an example, if you have a 1.25 command pod on top of a 2.5 wide tank, you can't step up to the door of the pod, as shown in screenshot here

As there are no more rungs above the ladder, it should allow my Kerbal to step on top of the ladder so he can reach the hatch, rather than as currently happens, they fall to the ground like idiots.
Place the smallest ladder on a 45 degree angle at the top. He will grab onto it as he moves off of the first ladder, and then continue to climb up onto the tank. Problem Solved.

Place the smallest ladder on a 45 degree angle at the top. He will grab onto it as he moves off of the first ladder, and then continue to climb up onto the tank. Problem Solved.

I consider this a workaround, and an ugly one at that. Kerbals should be able to get off a ladder at the top of something without it.
